newsitem.title: SPAIN: NATO-Russia council to hold first session July 17.
newsitem.headline: NATO-Russia council to hold first session July 17.

text.p: NATO and Russia will hold the first meeting of their joint council, created by a Founding Act signed in May, at ambassadorial level in Brussels on July 17, a senior NATO official announced on Monday.

He said the meeting would adopt procedures for the new body, due to discuss a wide range of European security issues, and prepare for a first ministerial meeting to be held in New York during the United Nations general assembly session in September.

The announcement was made on the eve of a NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organisation) summit due to invite the first former communist east European countries to join the Western alliance, a move bitterly opposed by Moscow.

The Founding Act, designed to lessen the Kremlin's hostility to NATO expansion, established a framework for confidence- building measures, including exchanges of military personnel, joint exercises and regular consultations on security matters.

The NATO official said Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov had written to NATO Secretary-General Javier Solana, suggesting that the new council should hold its inaugural session before the summer holidays.
